findings.title: Predictable random number generation
findings.explanation: The rand() function derives randomness solely from blockhash(block.number - 1) and block number. Miners can influence these values and predict or manipulate the outcome.
findings.fix_suggestion: Integrate a secure randomness oracle (e.g., Chainlink VRF) or use a commit–reveal scheme to prevent miner manipulation.

findings.title: Fallback function not payable
findings.explanation: The fallback function is not marked payable, so any attempt to send Ether to the contract will revert, blocking deposits and disabling the primary contract functionality.
findings.fix_suggestion: Mark the fallback function as payable: `function() payable { init(); }` or implement a receive() function in newer Solidity versions.

findings.title: Unchecked send return value when paying users
findings.explanation: The contract uses `.send()` to transfer Ether but does not check its return value before marking the entry as paid. If the send fails, the user will not receive funds but the entry will be considered paid, losing their payout.
findings.fix_suggestion: Check the return value of `send` and revert or retry on failure. Alternatively use `transfer` (Solidity <0.6) or `call{value:...}("")` with proper error handling.

findings.title: Struct copied instead of referenced, storage update lost
findings.explanation: `Entry theEntry = entries[unpaidEntries[index]];` creates a memory copy of the struct. Updating `theEntry.paid = true` modifies the copy, not the storage entry, leaving the actual entry unmarked.
findings.fix_suggestion: Declare the variable as a storage reference: `Entry storage theEntry = entries[unpaidEntries[index]];` so updates persist in contract storage.

findings.title: Incorrect fee validation in changeFee
findings.explanation: The function checks `if (fee > 5)` instead of validating `newFee`, allowing the owner to set any fee value and bypass the intended 0–5% limit.
findings.fix_suggestion: Validate the input parameter: `require(newFee <= 5, "Fee cannot exceed 5%"); fee = newFee;`.

findings.title: onlyowner modifier does not revert on unauthorized calls
findings.explanation: The `onlyowner` modifier uses `if (msg.sender == owner) _;` and silently returns on failure without reverting, leading to silent no-ops rather than explicit access rejections.
findings.fix_suggestion: Use `require(msg.sender == owner, "Caller is not owner");` to enforce access control and revert on unauthorized calls.

unmatched_predictions.title: Unchecked send return value when paying users
Struct copied instead of referenced, storage update lost
onlyowner modifier does not revert on unauthorized calls
